ANU.name: Patrick De Fontenay
expertise: Government And Politics Of Asia And The Pacific
interest: Macroeconomics/international economics Financial markets and instruments Training
ANU.biography: Dr. de Fontenay, a former Director of the IMF Institute, has remained active  in the training of officials from ministries of economy and finance, and central  banks, most recently from the People's Democratic Republic of Korea, the Solomon  Islands and Papua-New Guinea. His teaching and research focus on financial  markets and institutions, including pension reform in China

publication.title: Tonga Economic Survey 2009
publication.source: Pacific Economic Bulletin, vol. 24, no. 3, pp. 1-18
